greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of positive integer coefficients in n-th Bernoulli polynomial.
comment: This is, more explicitly, the number of positive integers of the form C(n+1,i)*B(i) where B(i) is the i-th Bernoulli number and C(n,k) is the binomial coefficient (k -sets from n distinct elements). The floor((n-1)/2) zero cases are excluded from this sequence. - _Olivier Gérard_, Oct 19 2005
reference: R. L. Graham et al., Concrete Math., Chapter 6.5, Bernoulli numbers
mathematica: Table[Count[ DeleteCases[ Table[Binomial[j + 1, i]*BernoulliB[ i], {i, 0, j}], 0], _Integer], {j, 0, 200}] (Gerard)
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Jun 19 2004
